Package test

Class WallController

Object
WallController
public class WallController extends Object
A controller class for Wall object to adhere according to the MVC (Model-View-Controller) design pattern.
Author:
KhooChenNan

  • Constructor Details

    • WallController

      public WallController​(Wall wallInput, Ball ballInput)
      Constructor for the "wallController.Java" class which sets the wall and ball attributes.
      Parameters:
      wallInput - The input parameter wall to set the wall controller's wall attribute.
      ballInput - The input parameter ball to set the wall controller's ball attribute.

  • Method Details

    • makeSingleTypeLevel

      private Brick[] makeSingleTypeLevel​(Rectangle drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCnt, double brickSizeRatio, int type)
      Constructs the level in such a way that it lines up the bricks in a monotonous way (consists of only 1 type of brick). Creates the bricks and then put them inside the array.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - The brick area.
      brickCount - The number of bricks.
      lineCnt - The number of lines of bricks.
      brickSizeRatio - The brick to size ratio.
      type - The type of brick to be used.
      Returns:
      The array of brick objects. (consists of multiple bricks)

    • makeChessboardLevel

      private Brick[] makeChessboardLevel​(Rectangle drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCnt, double brickSizeRatio, int typeA, int typeB)
      Constructs the level in such a way that it lines up the bricks in a chess board way. Creates the bricks and then put them inside the array.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - The brick area.
      brickCount - The number of bricks.
      lineCnt - The number of lines of bricks.
      brickSizeRatio - The brick to size ratio.
      typeA - The first type of brick to be used.
      typeB - The second type of brick to be used.
      Returns:
      The array of brick objects. (consists of multiple bricks)

    • makeLevels

      public void makeLevels​(Rectangle drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCount, double brickDimensionRatio)
      Construct the levels of the game. Calls functions such as makeSingleTypeLevel and makeChessboardLevel for construction.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - The brick area.
      brickCount - The number of bricks.
      lineCount - The number of lines of bricks.
      brickDimensionRatio - The brick to dimension ratio.

    • move

      public void move()
      Movements for the player and the ball

    • findImpacts

      public void findImpacts()
      To determine whether the ball has impact with the brick or the player. (In short, to determine the type of impact)

    • impactWall

      private boolean impactWall()
      A flag to tests if the ball comes in contact/impact with the Wall.
      Returns:
      Return a boolean to indicate whether the ball has impact with the brick.

    • impactBorder

      private boolean impactBorder()
      A function to check whether the ball has made impact with the border or not.
      Returns:
      A boolean to indicate whether the ball has made impact with the border.

    • makeBrick

      private Brick makeBrick​(Point point, Dimension size, int type)
      Constructs the brick by taking in 3 input parameters: the coordinates, the size, and the type of bricks.
      Parameters:
      point - The coordinates of the brick.
      size - The size of the brick.
      type - The type of brick.
      Returns:
      Returns the type of brick based on the input brick type.

    • ballReset

      public void ballReset()
      A function that resets the ball's coordinate back to the original position if the player dies. (BallCount > 0)

    • wallReset

      public void wallReset()
      A function that resets the bricks the moment the level has been cleared.

    • ballEnd

      public boolean ballEnd()
      A function to check whether the ball count is 0 or not.
      Returns:
      A boolean that returns true if the number of ball is 0.

    • isDone

      public boolean isDone()
      A function to check whether the brick count is 0 or not.
      Returns:
      A boolean that returns true if the number of brick is 0.

    • setBallXSpeed

      public void setBallXSpeed​(int s)
      Setter method for the ball's horizontal speed.
      Parameters:
      s - The horizontal speed of the ball to be set.

    • setBallYSpeed

      public void setBallYSpeed​(int s)
      Setter method for the ball's vertical speed.
      Parameters:
      s - The vertical speed of the ball to be set.

    • resetBallCount

      public void resetBallCount()
      A function that resets the number of ball count back to 3. (maximum life count)
